text:
Sandeep K Keloth
+91 - 9535501525
sandeepkkeloth@gmail.com
A Management & Technical Consultant for 15 years and an ITIL certified professional with extensive
subject matter expertise in Project Management, Operations, SAP BI Data warehousing, SAP HANA,
Oracle Technologies, coordination and support Services experience. And have worked in India, USA and
UAE. Seeking a leadership role in a fast-growing reputed company.
Professional Highlights
Having  worked  in a multinational  business  environment  for more than 15 years  and having direct
experience in the American, Europe, Australian, Arabian and Indian business ways. I have acquired Project
Development, Planning & Management experience in IT operation; in technical domains - SAP BI Data
warehousing, HANA & Oracle Technologies, Coordination and Support services. My process oriented
experience has helped my teams to develop efficient productive and profitable business solutions.
 
Managerial Capabilities 

Involved  in  project  initiation,  planning,  execution,  monitoring,  controlling  and  closing,  for
companies like E&Y, Accenture, IBM, WIPRO, ADEA technologies, Optimal Solutions etc.

Successfully lead a Unilever’s global project spanning multiple stakeholders, departments and
time zone to completion in 2015. 

An effective leader with proven abilities in leading teams during all Project phases. Has special
interest in training and guiding team members and sharing knowledge with team mates. 

Worked as a coordinator for a PMO.

Setting baseline, tracking and monitoring progress of projects while ensuring Consistent
delivery as per scope, budget and SLA.

Information Management: Communication and Status reporting.

Identifying and maintaining Effort tracking, SLA and Commitment tracking, Review,
Client Weekly reports.

Risk and Issue management: Maintaining an effective knowledge base for follow-ups.

Resource management to ensure on-time project completion

Business development initiatives

Actively involved Process transitions in adherence with Client’s requirements.

Being the Single point of contact for all Client and internal escalations.

Leading, mentoring and monitoring the performance of team members to ensure efficiency in
process operations and meeting of individual & group targets.
Technical Capabilities

Involved in more than 7 Full Life Cycle Implementations and Support Projects of SAP BI on
various kinds of assignments.

Handled leadership and technical roles in SAP BI, HANA and Oracle projects.

Industries worked in – Telecom, Banking and Finance, Mining, Retail/Distribution, Health and
life Science Industries for major and leading business houses across the world.

Represented companies as technical lead in business development initiatives.

Implemented SAP BI Data Warehousing projects using BI Modeling, Extraction and Reporting

Experienced in BI Architecture, Data flow strategy, Source System, Data Source, Data modeling
(Star Schema), Info Source, Info Objects, PSA, Data Targets, ODS (DSO), Multi Providers, Info
cubes, Info sets, process chains, Lo-cockpit - Enhancements, User Exits (Classes), BEx Analyzer,
Info sets, Query Optimizations and BW Security.

Expertise in the Performance techniques like Performance tuning, Aggregates, Compression,
Indexes and Rollups (Performance Improvement) and BIA. 

Involved in documenting Functional specifications and Technical specifications in SAP Solution
Manager, Test cases, Test results and Production support documents. 

Worked on Quality Mercury centre tool for testing of objects of BI objects.

Sandeep K Keloth, MCA, ITIL, (M) +91 9535501525
Page 2

Project: Unilever is a global company which makes many of the world famous brands, and products are
used in over half the households on the planet with a turnover of over €48 billion and sales in nearly
every country in the world.

I was overall responsible for delivery, project Management, status reports, weekly review meetings,
and overall coordination at global and offshore span till project closure. 

My role involves project management, on time delivery management, review of all deliverables,
managing resources, prepare plan on any team ramp-ups or ramp down based on discussion with
client & delivery managers.

Deputed at client location to manage the Supplier Net project, which is part of a global Supply
Chain System. 

Coordination with the global stake holders. Prepare & Update weekly status report to global and
offshore managers.

"Supplier Net" Project is an initiative from the global team to provide HUL Supplier data for global
supplier reporting. This involved development of custom extractors (Data source) and enhancing
standard SAP extractors in ECC from which BODS fetches data. 
Company
Accenture India
Client
AIES, Belgacom Group, AIG – Chartis, BHP Billiton
Duration
July 2010 – Jan 2014
Environment
SAP BI 7.3, SAP BI 7.0, SAP HANA on Windows 2000 
Role
Senior System Analyst
Project 1: The AIES is the Accenture innovation project capability from Accenture Innovation Center
India,  is  aimed  at  providing  a  one-stop  interface  for  understanding  and  analyzing  enterprise
environments to leveraging upon Enterprise architecture development of AIES. 

Managed Center of Excellence and was the single point of contact for all quality and knowledge
concerns.

I managed, Lead, mentored and monitored the performance of team members to ensure efficiency in
process operations and meeting of individual & group targets.

Worked  for  Enterprise  architecture  for  deploying  business  gathering  and  developing  the
implementation part of KPI169 and KPI 34 for BOSS on SAP HANA project. 

Performed Design and loading of data to MSSQL server and then parallel loading data in to SAP

 HANA server using flat files. Analyze and monitored the data in target system. 

Worked for the build for tables in HANA, attribute view, analytical view and calculation view for
these KPI’s. 

Working on Continuous improvement (CI) in the area of AIES on BW for transformation, update
rule structure and transfer.

Building Capability for HANA practice which involves in resource handling and cross training,
involved in the SAP HANA, BI estimation for future projects by using ADM estimator for getting
estimation for their releases. 

Conducting One to One meeting with the team members to address quality issues and provide
feedback on the quality of their work.

Ensuring under performers receive adequate coaching and documenting their feedback.
Project 2: The Belgacom Group is the largest telecommunications company in Belgium, headquartered
in Brussels.

I managed and led the SAP BI Practice for Belgacom Consolidation data warehouse Project a team
size of 4 members who were involved in the Implementation for Release.

During this project I was also a part of the presales team to help the SAP BI deals with responses
with respect to SAP BI. I have validated and provided inputs for the SAP BI ADM estimator for
getting estimates for their Releases.

Worked closely with the client requirement to understand, analyze and coordinate the requirement
which had no documentation initially in place. 
Sandeep K Keloth, MCA, ITIL, (M) +91 9535501525
Page 3


In order to create for every BI info cube object an interface between the Data warehouse of Telindus
and the Teradata database, team created Open hubs object to export data. For every export we
created open Hub in the Development and later transport to Quality and Production. 

Project created open hubs data flow for more than 250 open hubs for Priority 1 and 3 delta and full
loads. 

Also documented a detailed excel document for all open hub objects and its attributes of with a
detail functional explanation. 

Managed and Coordinated the activities between India and Brussels region, I setup and managed the
offshore BI Team involved in the build, documentation and test phase of the Project.

Conducting One to One meeting to address quality issues and provide team members feedback on
the quality of their work.

Involved in monitoring and controlling the project on day to day basis and taken appropriate
measures to bring the project in line whenever there were deviations.
Project 3: American International Group, also known as AIG, is an American multinational insurance
corporation.

Led the SAP BI team for AIG Chartis Project. I was involved in Managing the offshore BI Team.

I  was  involved  during  the  development  of  Blueprints,  Reporting  requirements,  requirement
gathering, implementation and various other phases of the Project.

Various  report  solution were done for FI and IM module. The solution was done for Asset
accounting, Actual, Budget, Forecasting, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivables from BI
point of view. Some part for the work also included BO reports as the clients want to generate
reports in BO reports.

Add on development on creating the Data flow designs for US Actual data which is coming from
ECC and created the data flows for International actual, budget and forecast data which are coming
from the ePlanning and created the BEx Reports with different types of requirements as per the
Functional Documents in my tenure of this project, and recommended all the feasible scope
/enhancements that can bring lot of improvements towards the current service offered. 

Have created the list of SAP BI Objects as per the Functional Design Document and also interacted
with the BO team to understand the business requirement.

Continuously monitored the risks of the project and implemented the mitigation plans successfully.
Project 4:  BHP Billiton is a Leading global natural resources company, one of the world's premier
mining companies. Project includes the R1D and R3 Projects to implement FI for BHP Billiton in SAP
BI across the globe. 

This project is a SAP BI 7.0 implementation in FICO for BHP Billiton (AU). 

As a System Analyst my role is to understand the requirements for the reports and delegate it to the
team and coordinate its members. I was sole responsible for design and development of major
reports in FI like Credit Risk Management, Product Risk management, Mark to Market, Trading
Profit and Loss and Exposure reports in R1D release. 

Leading, mentoring and monitoring the performance of team members to ensure efficiency in
process operations and meeting of individual & group targets.

In R3 release I had worked immense in Matrix report. I had worked closely with the design team
and process architects on requirement gathering, designing the technical data flow model for all the
reports and cascaded this to the team. 

I was involved in different phases of testing like Component Test, Unit Test & Integration testing.
During this phase, my responsibility is to make user's understand the requirements about the reports
and also support them during testing. 

I was also responsible for the defect management process for the current project. This includes
defect assignment to the members within the team, keeping track of the priority defects. 

Organize weekly meetings on the root cause of the defect, lessons learnt is shared across the team to
restrain similar defects in future. 

I had worked on ARIS, a tool for creating Technical Data Models for the reports. 

Tested all the developed objects using Unit Test scenarios from Source System to the Data Target
level as well as report level and recorded in HPQC (Quality Center).

Project: Weyerhaeuser is the world’s largest private owner of merchantable softwood timber and the


This project is a Purely an Implementation project of SAP BI based solution. The module covers
COPC and there subject areas. 

Involved in studying the “As-Is” business processes within Weyerhaeuser, and proposed “To-Be”
processes to be followed by the firm during the Blue print phase. As part of designing the “To-Be”
processes for New Connection, successfully developed a method of handling New Connection
cases. 

Created Technical design documents for the enhancements and reports during the Realization phase.
Conceptual Knowledge of Multidimensional Data Model using Extended Star Schema for COPC
Module,  Subject  Areas  which  includes  Manufacturing  By  Department  (MBD)  and  Inventory
Valuations. 

Performed system testing and Involved in unit testing the BI objects with testing tool called
Mercury Quality Centre. 

Prepared Business Process Design documents for the various processes during the blue print phase. 

Prepared Functional design documents for the enhancements and reports to be custom developed


Prepared scripts for testing of various scenarios, after the configurations and developments were


Presented weekly status reports to the Project Management, informing them on the status of each
deliverable. 

Worked as a coordinator, liaising between the functional teams and the Development team, to
complete the developments as per schedule.

Project: UCB is a leading global biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the research, development


This project was aimed at Implementation (PS Module) and enhancements for a SAP BW based

Uploaded Master and Transactional data from SAP as the OLTP source. Customized Info Objects,

Variables, Exceptions and Conditions. 

Created UDD Documentation for the whole PS Development Project.
